availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Burton (Monticello, Kentucky, judge and teacher.)

body.p: Monticello, Kentucky, judge and teacher. Kentucky native. Married Mary E. Frisbie in Wayne County, Kentucky on September 14, 1847. Father of Johnathan S. Burton, Josephine Burton, and Bettie Burton. Married Julia Frisbie Burton in Wayne County, Kentucky on August 31, 1854. Father of Clementine Burton, Willette Burton, and Robert Burton. School teacher in Wayne County in 1850. Police judge of Monticello in 1860. High school teacher in Monticello in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, Division 1, p. 286B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, Monticello, p. 230.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Wayne County Marriages, Film #, p.000591550, p. 113.
The Miscellaneous Documents of the House of Representatives, 1859-1860, volume 4 (Washington: Thomas H. Ford, 1860), 613.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Wayne County Marriages, Film #, p.000591550.
